dmc
Class DMC

java.lang.Object
  dmc.DMC
Direct Known Subclasses:
DMC_SHO
public class DMC
extends java.lang.Object

A Diffusion Monte Carlo Simulation. This class implements the basic DMC structure as outlined in "Introduction to the Diffusion Monte Carlo Method" by Ioan Kosztin, Byron Faber and Klaus Schulten in 1995. It only provides the basic methods for the walkers to be moved, to be born and to die. The actual simulation loop with start and end conditions must be implemented in another class. This class is meant to be subclassed; the child class will overwrite the V() function to give the simulation a valid potential.

Author:
Ian Terrell

Constructor Detail

DMC

public DMC(int numWalkers,
           double refEnergy,
           boolean refEnergyConstant,
           double dTau,
           double alpha,
           long seed,
           int initMode,
           double param1,
           double param2)
Constructor. Takes one of everything and initializes the simulation.

Parameters:
numWalkers - The number of walkers to start the simulation with.
refEnergy - The reference energy to start the simulation with. If it is negative, use the current average energy of all the walkers.
refEnergyConstant - Whether or not to hold the reference energy constant.
dTau - The timestep to use.
alpha - The feedback parameter to use (use -1.0 to use the default value of 1/dTau).
seed - The long int to seed the random variate generator.
initMode - The mode in which to initialize the random walkers.
param1 - First parameter for the initialization mode. X_0 for delta functions, a for Uniform, mu for Gaussian
param2 - Second parameter for the initialization mode. unused for delta functions, b for Uniform, sigma for Gaussian

DMC

public DMC(int numWalkers,
           double initialPosition,
           long seed)
This constructor constructs a simulation with a delta function walker initialization about point initialPosition, the seed given, and the number of walkers given, but everything else with default values.

Parameters:
numWalkers - The number of walkers to start the simulation with.
initialPosition - The position at which to start the walkers.
seed - The long int to seed the random variate generator.
Method Detail

V

public double V(double x)
This is the potential energy function, and is meant to be overwritten by a derived class.

Parameters:
x - The point at which to get the potential
Returns:
Returns the potential energy at point x

Weight

public double Weight(Walker w)
This function returns the weight of a walker.

Parameters:
w - The walker to return the weight of.

Iterate

public void Iterate()
This function does one complete iteration of the simulation, including moving the walkers, branching them, and updating the reference energy.

walk

public void walk()
This function moves each of the walkers, and updates the reference energy with respect to their new positions.

Throws:
java.lang.ArithmeticException - Thrown if the number of walkers drops to 0. A specialized exception should probably be made eventually.

branch

public void branch()
Branches the walkers. (Birth/Death process)
